intro: Monolopia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf false nettle, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy on the underside, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its stems are often reddish and can become woody with age. The plant is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms.
